segments.description: Measure-Measure 12 ounces of cold water
segments.step_name: Measure-Measure 12 ounces of cold water

segments.description: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug
segments.step_name: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug

segments.description: transfer-transfer water to a kettle
segments.step_name: transfer-transfer water to a kettle

segments.description: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle
segments.step_name: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle

segments.description: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper
segments.step_name: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper

segments.description: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone
segments.step_name: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone

segments.description: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)
segments.step_name: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)

segments.description: Weigh-Weigh the coffee beans (0.8oz-0.12 oz)
segments.step_name: Weigh-Weigh the coffee beans (0.8oz-0.12 oz)

segments.description: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds
segments.step_name: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds

segments.description: check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)
segments.step_name: check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)

segments.description: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone
segments.step_name: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone

segments.description: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds
segments.step_name: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds

segments.description: Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)
segments.step_name: Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)

segments.description: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter
segments.step_name: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter

segments.description: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper
segments.step_name: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper

segments.description: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds
segments.step_name: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds

segments.description: Whisk-Whisk to combine mixture of flour, sugar and baking powder in the bowl

segments.description: Whisk-Whisk batter until no lumps remain

segments.description: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue
segments.step_name: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue

segments.description: Invert-Invert the mug to release the cake onto a plate

segments.description: Allow-Allow to cool until it is no longer hot to the touch

segments.description: Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tsp vegetable oil to the bowl
segments.step_name: Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tsp vegetable oil to the bowl

segments.description: Whisk-Whisk batter until no lumps remain

segments.description: Pour-Pour batter into prepared mug
segments.step_name: Pour-Pour batter into prepared mug

segments.description: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue
segments.step_name: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. segments.description: Invert-Invert the mug to release the cake onto a plate

segments.description: Allow-Allow to cool until it is no longer hot to the touch

segments.description: remove-then carefully remove the paper liner

segments.description: Scoop-While the cake is cooling, prepare to pipe the frosting. Scoop 4 spoonfuls of chocolate frosting into a zip-top bag

segments.description: seal-seal zip top bag, removing as much air as possible

segments.description: cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/4 inch in diameter
segments.step_name: cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/4 inch in diameter

segments.description: Squeeze-Squeeze the frosting through the opening to apply small dollops of frosting to the plate in a circle around the base of the cake

1.name: Pour-Pour 1 egg into the ramekin cup

2.name: Place -Place the egg from the cup over the lettuce

3.name: Coat -Coat a 6-oz. ramekin cup with cooking spray

4.name: Microwave-Microwave the ramekin cup uncovered on high for 30 seconds

5.name: sprinkle -sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cheese on cup

6.name: Top -Top cup with 1 tablespoon of salsa

7.name: replace -replace the top of the English muffin

8.name: Microwave -Continue to Microwave for 15-30 more seconds or until the egg is almost set

9.name: Line -Line the bottom piece of the English muffin with lettuce

10.name: Microwave -Microwave just until cheese melts, about 10 seconds

12.name: Cut -Cut the English muffin into two pieces with a knife

15.name: Pour-Pour the sauces over the meatballs

18.name: Stir-Stir the contents in the microwave with a spoon

20.name: Microwave-Microwave the plate, covered, on high for 1.5 minutes

21.name: Place-Place 5 meatballs in a Microwave-safe plate

22.name: Cut-Cut 1/4 medium carrot into short, thin strips

23.name: Mix-Mix 1/4 cup sweet-and-sour sauce and 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce in a small bowl

24.name: Top-Top the plate with the carrots, onion, garlic and 1/4 tsp pepper powder

28.name: add-Measure 1/8 teaspoon of salt and add it to the mug

29.name: Sprinkle-Sprinkle dried Italian herbs inside the mug

31.name: spread-spread marinara sauce around the surface of the batter

32.name: Microwave-Microwave for 1 minute 20 seconds, or until it rises and the toppings are bubbling

33.name: add-Measure 4 tablespoons of flour and add it to the mug

34.name: Add-1 tablespoon of olive oil to the mug

35.name: add-Measure 1/16 teaspoon of baking soda and add it to the mug

37.name: Mix-Mix the contents of the mug thoroughly. (There might be some lumps, but that is ok.)

38.name: Stir-Stir the contents in the mug well

39.name: Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1 generous tablespoon of mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce

40.name: add-Measure 1/8 teaspoon of baking powder and add it to the mug

41.name: Add-Add in 3 tablespoons of milk to the mug

42.name: Mix-Mix in the flavour packet to the bowl

43.name: Stir-Stir noodles with a spoon or fork until the flavouring dissolves

44.name: Remove-Remove the noodles from the package(Break Noodles / Keep them as a block)

48.name: Let-Let the noodles sit for about 1 minute after the microwave stops

49.name: Cover-Cover with a lid (or paper towel) to prevent splattering

51.name: Chop-Chop 1 garlic clove on a cutting board

52.name: Add-Add the noodles to the bowl

53.name: Add-Add chopped cilantro to the bowl

54.name: Put-Put all the Vegetables in a microwave-safe bowl

56.name: Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)

57.name: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds

58.name: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone

59.name: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone

60.name: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper

61.name: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter

62.name: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle, and in half again to create a quarter-circle

63.name: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds

64.name: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling, assemble the filter cone)

66.name: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper

67.name: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand, about 20 seconds

69.name: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug

71.name: check-Once the water has boiled, check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot, let it cool briefly.)

73.name: Microwave-Microwave for 3 minutes, stirring in between

74.name: Add-Add 1/2 tbsp sweet and sour sauce to the bowl

75.name: Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1 tbsp shredded cheddar cheese on top of the egg

76.name: Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl well

77.name: add-Extract and add contents of an egg to a microwave-safe bowl

78.name: Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to another into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps but not so tight that the filling leaks

79.name: Pour-Pour egg mixture on top of the tortilla

80.name: Add-Add 1 tbsp salsa to the bowl

81.name: Place-Place 8 inch tortilla on a cutting board

83.name: Heat-Heat the contents of the mug for 1 minute and serve

84.name: Add-Add 1/5 teaspoon cinnamon to the mug

85.name: Mix-Mix the contents of the mug

87.name: Add-Add 1 teaspoon of white sugar to the mug

88.name: Fill-Fill a microwave-safe mug with skimmed milk

89.name: Microwave-Microwave the contents of the mug for 1 minute

90.name: Add-Add 2 pieces of chocolate to the mug

91.name: Microwave-Microwave on high for 90 seconds until the egg is cooked through

92.name: add-add bread pieces to the egg mixture in the mug, pressing the bread down into the egg

94.name: melt-In a large mug, melt 1 tablespoon of softened butter in the microwave for about 30 seconds

95.name: Sprinkle-Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon over the egg

96.name: cut-cut the contents on plate, and serve

97.name: Put-Put the mug's contents on a plate

98.name: Roll-Roll the butter around in the mug to coat it

99.name: Cut or tear-Cut or tear 1 slices of bread into bite-size pieces

100.name: Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract to the mug

101.name: whisk-In the mug, whisk one egg with a fork until well blended

102.name: slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel

104.name: Clean-Clean the knife by wiping with a paper towel

105.name: Cross-Cross the floss's two ends over the tortilla roll's top

106.name: Slide-Slide floss under the tortilla, perpendicular to the length of the roll

107.name: Spread-Spread jelly over the nut butter

108.name: pull-pull the floss ends in opposite directions to slice

109.name: Place-Place the pinwheels on a plate

110.name: Secure-Secure the rolled tortilla by inserting 5 toothpicks about 1 inch apart

111.name: scoop-Use the knife to scoop jelly from the jar

112.name: Spread-Spread nut butter onto the tortilla, leaving 1/2-inch uncovered at the edges

113.name: scoop-Use a butter knife to scoop nut butter from the jar

114.name: Trim-Trim the ends of the tortilla roll with the butter knife, leaving 1/2 inch margin between the last toothpick and the end of the roll

115.name: Place-Place 8-inch flour tortilla on cutting board

116.name: Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to the other into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps, but not so tight that the filling leaks

117.name: Place-Place the floss halfway between toothpicks

118.name: Clean-Clean the knife by wiping it with a paper towel

119.name: Slice-Slice one tomato into about 1/2 inch thick slices

120.name: Place-Place the thick slices of tomatoes on a platter, ensuring they only make a single layer

121.name: Add-Add a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, about 1 tablespoon, over the entire platter

122.name: dry-gently dry it with a paper/tea towel

123.name: Season-Season the tomato slices with salt

124.name: Sprinkle-Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top of the tomato throughout the platter

126.name: Season-Season platter with 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

76.name: Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl well

128.name: add-add lime juice to the bowl

130.name: Add-1 teaspoon of pepper powder to the bowl

132.name: Add-Add the corn into a microwave-safe bowl

134.name: Microwave-Microwave the corn for 3 more minutes

136.name: Add-Add 1 teaspoon salt to the bowl

137.name: Thaw-Thaw the frozen corn by putting it in a sieve and running it under cold water

139.name: Add-Add 1/4 tsp mustard to the pan

141.name: Add-1/2 tsp cumin seeds to the pan

142.name: Add-Add tomato puree to the pan

143.name: Take-Take the pan off the heat

144.name: Mix-Mix well tomato puree with contents in the pan

146.name: Add-1/2 tsp salt to the pan

147.name: Add-Add 2 tbsp red chili powder to the pan

150.name: puree-puree tomatoes without any water in a blender/mixer

152.name: add-When mustard and cumin seeds begin to sizzle, add minced garlic

153.name: simmer-Allow the mixture to simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until the mixture becomes thick

154.name: Heat-Heat 3 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat

155.name: Chop-Chop tomato roughly (anysize chunks are fine)

156.name: Transfer-Transfer it to a serving bowl

157.name: mix-mix well contents of the pan

159.name: Whisk-Whisk the egg mixture in the bowl

164.name: add-add 1/3 tsp salt to the bowl

166.name: Saute-Saute the onions on medium heat until they are soft and translucent

167.name: Crack-Crack one egg in the bowl

168.name: Add-Add 1/8 tsp of turmeric to the pan

170.name: Cook-Cook covered for 1 minute or until the tomatoes soften

171.name: mixing-Keep mixing with a spatula for 3 minutes or until the eggs are almost cooked

172.name: pour-Slowly pour the whisked eggs into the pan

173.name: Heat-Heat 2 tbsp oil in a heavy-bottomed or nonstick pan on medium heat

174.name: Garnish-Garnish with 1 tbsp chopped cilantro and serve

177.name: add-add 1 tbsp milk to the bowl

178.name: add-add 1/3 tsp salt to the pan

179.name: add-add chopped onions to the pan

181.name: Add-1/4 teaspoon of red chilli powder to the bowl

183.name: whisk-In a mixing bowl, whisk 1 cup of chilled curd until smooth. Use fresh homemade or packaged curd

184.name: Add-1/4 teaspoon salt to the bowl

185.name: chop or grate-chop or grate the cucumber

186.name: Combine-Combine all the ingredients in the bowl

187.name: add-add 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro leaves to the bowl

188.name: Add-Add 1 teaspoon of cumin powder to the bowl

190.name: Add-Add the chopped or grated cucumber to the whisked curd

191.name: Add-1/2 teaspoon of chaat masala powder to the bowl

192.name: Cook-Cook for 2 minutes or until the zoodles are done

195.name: Top-Top with more parmesan if desired

196.name: Heat-Heat a large pan on medium heat

199.name: Add-Add 1 large minced garlic cloves to the pan

202.name: Cook-Cook garlic until fragrant (about 1 minutes). Be careful not to burn garlic

203.name: Spiralize-Spiralize 1 medium zucchini into thin noodles using a spiralizer

205.name: pat-pat rinsed mushrooms dry with a paper towel

207.name: cook-cook the pan, often stirring, for 1 minute

208.name: add-Once the pan is hot, add the mushrooms

209.name: Add-Add chopped shallot to the pan

213.name: cook-cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring often, until mushrooms start to soften and brown

215.name: Heat-Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat

216.name: Transfer-Transfer the contents of the pan to a serving dish

217.name: Add-1/4 tbsp balsamic vinegar to the pan

218.name: Add-Add 2 cloves of minced garlic to the pan

221.name: Add-1/2 tsp baking powder to a blender

222.name: Serve-Serve the pancakes with chopped strawberries

223.name: Melt-Melt a small knob of butter in a non-stick frying pan over low-medium heat

226.name: Cook-Cook for 1 min or until the tops start to bubble

228.name: Flip-Flip the pancakes with a fork or a fish slice spatula

231.name: Pour-Pour three little puddles straight from the blender into the frying pan

232.name: Add-1 heaped tbsp flour to a blender

235.name: Heat-Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan

236.name: put-put tomatoes on a serving plate

238.name: stir-stir gently with a wooden spoon so the egg that sets on the base of the pan moves to enable the uncooked egg to flow into the space

239.name: crack-crack one egg in a bowl

240.name: cook-cook the tomatoes cut-side down until they start to soften and colour

241.name: Pour-Pour the egg mixture into the pan

242.name: add-add the chopped cilantro to the bowl

243.name: Transfer-Transfer omelette to the plate and serve with the tomatoes

244.name: Scoop-Scoop the tomatoes from the pan

245.name: Stop-Stop stirring when it's nearly cooked to allow it to set into an omelette

248.name: Beat-Beat the contents of the bowl

249.name: add-1/2 tsp ground black pepper to the bowl

250.name: Add-Add 1/8 cup soy sauce to the bowl

252.name: Add-Add 1 tablespoon honey to the bowl

253.name: cook-cook, stirring often, for 4 minutes. If the pan gets too hot on medium-high, turn the heat down to medium

254.name: Add-Add 1 teaspoon cornstarch to the bowl

255.name: Add-Add 2 cloves minced garlic to the bowl

256.name: Pour-Pour the sauce into the skillet

258.name: Add-add sliced mushrooms to the skillet

261.name: Add-Add bell pepper to the skillet

264.name: cook-cook, stirring, for 1 minute until the sauce thickens

266.name: Heat-Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat

267.name: Add-Add 1/2 tablespoon minced ginger to the bowl

268.name: Add-Add 1/8 teaspoon black pepper to the bowl

272.name: Whisk-Whisk the sauce again to recombine the ingredients

274.name: continue cooking-continue cooking, stirring often, for 2-3 minutes, until vegetables are crisp-tender

275.name: Cut-Cut 1/4 block or 3 ounces of fresh tofu into large cubes (about 1 in x 1 in)

276.name: Turn-Turn on the heat to medium

277.name: drizzle-drizzle 1 tablespoon soy sauce (watch for spitting) on the pan

278.name: drizzle-drizzle with the 1 tablespoons sesame oil on the pan

279.name: add-add the tofu cubes to the pan

280.name: remove-Briefly remove the pan from the heat to reduce spitting

282.name: remove-Briefly remove from the heat again

286.name: add-add 1/4 tsp salt to the pan

288.name: cook-cook pan for 2 minutes until the colour is darkened

291.name: Add-Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a non-stick pan

292.name: Cook-Cook 5 to 6 minutes until tofu cubes are lightly browned on the bottom

293.name: pat-pat tofu dry with a towel

294.name: Whisk-Whisk batter until no lumps remain

295.name: remove-then carefully remove the paper liner

296.name: Measure and add-2 tbsp water to the bowl

297.name: Measure and add-1.5 tbsp sugar to the mixing bowl

298.name: Scoop-While the cake is cooling, prepare to pipe the frosting. Scoop 4 spoonfuls of chocolate frosting into a zip-top bag

299.name: Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tbsp flour to the mixing bowl

300.name: Measure and add-Measure and add 2 tsp vegetable oil to the bowl

302.name: Squeeze-Squeeze the frosting through the opening to apply small dollops of frosting to the plate in a circle around the base of the cake

303.name: Place-Place the paper cupcake liner inside the mug

304.name: Measure and add-1/4 tsp baking powder to the bowl

305.name: Allow-Allow to cool until it is no longer hot to the touch

306.name: cut-Use scissors to cut one corner from the bag to create a small opening 1/4 inch in diameter

308.name: Whisk-Whisk to combine mixture of flour, sugar and baking powder in the bowl

309.name: Invert-Invert the mug to release the cake onto a plate

310.name: Measure and add-a pinch of salt to the mixing bowl

311.name: seal-seal zip top bag, removing as much air as possible

312.name: Microwave-Microwave the mug and batter on high power for 60 seconds. Check if the cake is done by inserting and toothpick into the center of the cake and then removing it. If wet batter clings to the toothpick, microwave for an additional 5 seconds. If the toothpick comes out clean, continue

313.name: Measure and add-1/4 tsp vanilla extract to the bowl

314.name: add-add 1/2 tbsp softened butter to the bowl

315.name: Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon salt to the bowl

316.name: Add-Add 1/3 cup cheddar cheese to a microwave-safe cup

317.name: Mix-Mix the cheese and red bell pepper in the bowl

318.name: Microwave-Microwave the bowl, covered, for 2 minutes

319.name: Add-Add 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the bowl

320.name: Add-Add 1 tablespoons of water to the bowl

321.name: Chop-Chop 1/4 red bell pepper into tiny bits

322.name: Place-Place the chopped pepper in the microwave-safe bowl

323.name: Melt-Melt the cheese by microwaving cup for 30 sec. (Check after 30 seconds and microwave for 10 seconds more if needed)

324.name: Mix-Mix all the ingredients of the bowl well

325.name: place-place avocado slices on each leaf

326.name: Season-season 1/4 tsp pepper on the bowl

327.name: Add-1/4 cup mayonnaise to the bowl

331.name: Mix-Mix the contents of the bowl

332.name: top-top lettuce leaves with the tuna mixture

333.name: Add-add chopped scallion to the bowl

334.name: Add-Add 1 can drained tuna to the bowl

337.name: secure-secure the wrap with a toothpick

339.name: Add-1 tsp Sriracha sauce to the bowl

342.name: add-1/8 cup shredded mozzarella to a bowl

343.name: add-1/4 tsp salt to a bowl

344.name: Slice-Slice two 1/2 inch thick rounds from a baguette (slice slanted)

345.name: Spoon-Spoon the mixture from the bowl onto the bread

346.name: add-1/4 tsp pepper to a bowl

347.name: add-1/16 cup basil to a bowl

348.name: Combine-Combine the contents of the bowl

349.name: Brush-Brush 2 slices of baguette with olive oil on both sides

350.name: Cut-Cut 1/4 cup of cherry tomatoes into halves

351.name: add-In a bowl, add the cut cherry tomatoes

352.name: Toast-Toast both sides of the slices on the pan for 2 to 3 minutes until lightly charred and crispy and transfer the slices to a plate
